shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Daily Office Prayers and Litanies (fols. 5ra-21vb) II) Śǝrʿatä qǝddase “Ordinary of the Mass” (fols. 21vb-51va) III) Anaphoras (fols. 51va-128ra) III-1) Anaphora of the Apostles (fols. 51va-62vb) III-2) Anaphora of Our Lord Jesus Christ (fols. 63va-66rb) III-3) Anaphora of Our Lady by St. Cyriacus of Behnesa (fols. 66rb-74vb) III-4) Anaphora of St. John, Son of Thunder (fols. 74vb-81vb) III-5) Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicaea (fols. 81vb-88ra) III-6) Anaphora of St. Athanasius of Alexandria (fols. 88rb-96ra) III-7) Anaphora of St. Basil of Caesarea (fols. 96ra-102rb) III-8) Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Hosanna-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 102rb-106vb) III-9) Anaphora of St. Epiphanius of Cyprus (fols. 106vb-111ra) III-10) Anaphora of St. Dioscorus of Alexandria (fols. 111ra-113ra) III-11) Anaphora of St. John Chrysostom (fols. 113ra-116vb) III-12) Anaphora of St. Cyril of Alexandria (fols. 116vb-121rb) III-13) Anaphora of St. Jacob of Serug (fols. 121rb-125vb) III-14) Second Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Christmas-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 125vb-128ra) IV) Directives for the ministers concerning priestly blessings (fol. 128ra-vb), in Amharic and Gǝʿǝz V) Śǝrʿatä betä krǝstiyan “The Order of the Church” (fols. 129ra-vb; 130rb-133rb), in Amharic (fol. 129ra-vb) and Gǝʿǝz (fols. 130rb-133rb) VI) Unidentified text (fol. 130ra) VII) Tǝmhǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat “The Teaching of Mysteries” (fols. 133rb-134vb)
Additio 1.

donors.donor: Gäbrä Ḥǝywät, Wälättä Kidan, Wälättä Maryam (mentioned in supplication formulas, s. fols. 66rb, 74vb, 88rb, etc.).

dcomments.dcomment: Fols. 19rb, 46rb, etc.: Ḫaylä Śǝllase is mentioned as the reigning Emperor. Ḫaylä Śǝllase was Emperor of Ethiopia in 1930-74. Additio 1 is dated to Mäskäräm 4, 1928 A.M. (= Sunday, September 15, 1935 A.D.).

txstates.txstate: Some leaves are heavily stained with dirt. Circular patch of parchment has been sewn on to the verso side to fill a hole in the leaf. On both sides the patch contains the text expected in these places: fol. 65vb.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather (partly missing); textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(4/fols. 1r-4v) – ፩I(8/fols. 5r-12v) – ፪II(8/fols. 13r-20v) – ፫III(8/fols. 21r-28v) – ፬IV(8/fols. 29r-36v) –፭V (10/fols. 37r-46v) – ፮VI(10/fols. 47r-56v) – ፯VII(8/fols. 57r-64v) – ፰VIII(10/fols. 65r-74v) – ፱IX(8/fols. 75r-82v) – ፲X(8/fols. 83r-90v) – ፲፩XI(8/fols. 91r-98v) – ፲፪XII(10/fols. 99r-108v) – ፲፫XIII(8/fols. 109r-116v) – ፲፬ XIV(8/fols. 117r-124v) – ፲፭ XV(4/fols. 125r-128v) – ፲፮XVI(8/fols. 129r-136v)

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are mostly visible (s. fol. 8r). Ruling pricks are mostly visible (s. fol. 82r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are mostly visible (s. fol. 8r). Ruling pricks are mostly visible (s. fol. 82r). Structural pricks are partly visible (s. fols. 73v-74r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Fine, fluent, regular, by trained hand.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; name of the ruling King; names of the donors in supplication formulas; incipits and headings of the texts; directives for the ministers; abbreviations; some of the musical notation signs above the lines; elements of the punctuation signs and Ethiopic numerals; quire numbers.
The text on fol. 5r is written alternately in red and black lines. On fol. 69va-vb, in the repeated abbreviation አብ፡ ወወል፡ ወመ፡ (s. Abbreviations) every odd letter is rubricated.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካህን፡ ይዲ፡ or ዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ ይሕ፡ or ሕ፡ for ይበል፡ ሕዝብ፡ ቡ፡ or ቡራ፡ for ቡራኬ፡ እ፡ for እማሬ፡ አብ፡ ወወል፡ ወመ፡ for አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ (s. fol. 69va-vb) አ፡ አ፡ አ፡ for አሜን፡ አሜን፡ አሜን፡ (s. fol. 119rb)

otherdetails.otherdetail: Text V, incipit of the Amharic section (fol. 129ra ls.1-5): በስመ፡<...> ሥርዓተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ቍርባን። ምን፡ ቀኝ (sic)፡ ተጀመረ፡ ያሉ፡ እንደሆነ፡ የጸሎተ፡ ሐሙስ፡ ዕለት፡ ማን፡ ጀመረ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ እለ፡ ማን፡ ቈረቡ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ Explicit (fol. 129vb ls.19-22): በዓቢይ፡ ጾም፡ ፵፭ጽላ፡ ይቍረብ፡ በ፲፫ወይን፡ ይቈረብ፡ በ፲፫ኅብስት፡ ይቈረብ፡ ከዚያ፡ ሌላ፡ አይደለም፡ እማሬ፡ ፲፪ነው፡ ቡራኬ፡ ፵፪ጊዜ፡ ነው፡ ድማሬ፡ ፩ጊዜ፡ ነው፨ Incipit of the Gǝʿǝz section (fol. 130rb ls.1-5): በስመ፡<...> ሥርዓተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፨ ንጽሕፍ፨ ፨ ወሕጋጋቲሃ፡ ወሃይማኖት፡ በከመ፡ ሠርዑ፡ አበዊነ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ወአበዊነ፡ ሊቃውንት፡ እንዘ፡ ኢንሜህር፡ ካልዓ፡ በከመ፡ ይቤ፡ ጳውሎስ፡ Explicit (fol. 133rb ls.21-23): ማንጦን፨ ንጹሕ፡ ዘአልቦ፡ ኃጢአት፡ ፓንዋማንጦን፨ ብሂል፡ ቅዱሰ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ አላትዮን፡ ብሂል፡ አምላከ፡ አማልክት፨ The text contains short biographies of the alleged authors of the Ethiopic Anaphoras. Text VI, incipit (fol. 130ra ls.1-3): በግብረ፡ ኣናጕንስጢስ፡ አንበበ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ዘይቤ፡ መንፈሰ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ላዕሌየ፡ ዘበእንቲአሁ፡ ቀብዓኒ፡ Explicit (fol. 130ra, ls.29-32): ቀዳሚ፡ ነበበ፡ ምስለ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ኀቢሮሙ፡ ድኅረኒ፡ ነበበ፡ ወደረሰ፡ ባሕቲቱ፡ ወልማዱ፡ ውእቱ፡ ለዮሐንስ፡ ወጢን፡ በቀዳማይናሁ፨ The first part of Text VI contains enumeration of scriptural readings appropriate for various occasions. Below the text apparently contains information pertaining to the Anaphora of the Apostles. For Text VII, cp. E. HAMMERSCHMIDT, Äthiopische liturgische Texte der Bodleian Library in Oxford, Berlin 1960 (Deutsche Akademie der Wissenschaften zu Berlin, Institut für Orientforschung 38), 37-72. The hymn Śärawitä mälaʾǝktihu lä-mädḫane ʿaläm „The hosts of the angels of the Savior of the World“ is written in compressed script (s. fols. 120va, 123rb, 127va).

additional.cont: Fol. 135v: Extensive note concerning administrative matters and income of the Bet Ḥawaryat church.
additional.det: In Amharic. Dated to Mäskäräm 4, 1928 A.M. (= Sunday, September 15, 1935 A.D.). The note lists several place names, e. g., Mǝʿguma, ʿAddigädiʿa, May Ḥam(m)o. Crude note in Amharic is added below.

extras.extra: - Texts IV-VII are written in smaller script. Unfinished crude note (beginning of a letter?); poorly legible: fol. 2r. - Minor notes: fol. 4r, 54r, 55r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: Indications of liturgical occasions on which the respective Anaphoras should be celebrated. Most of these texts are enclosed in rectangles or placed between two horizontal lines: fols. 66r, 74v, 62r, 88r, 96r, 102r, 106v, 111r, 113r, 116v (in the upper margin).

drawing.details: Schematic representation of the Eucharistic bread and its distribution among the participants of the Liturgy. The portions are indicated by inscriptions in the cells.

drawing.info: Fol. 135r: Body of Christ before burial.
drawing.details: Body of Christ before burial represented in the form of a cross. Each of the four cardinal points is associated with a part of Christ’s body and with a personage from New Testament history. The four intercardinal points are also indicated. The inscription below the drawing reads: በይነ፡ ምንት፡ ይሁብዎ፡ ለዲያቆን፡ መስቀል (sic)፡ ማእከላዊ፡ እስጢፋኖስ፡ በእንተ፡ ዘቀደመ፡ ሰማዕትና። “Why do they give the deacon the central cross? Because of Stephen who was the first martyr.”

frames.frame: - Fol. 5r: Wide coloured (red, yellow, lilac, black) ornamental band over cols. a-b, with one central and two lateral extensions reaching the bottom of the page; geometric motifs. - Fol. 51va: Narrow coloured (red, green, yellow) ornamental band; geometric motifs. - Fol. 62ra: Narrow coloured (red, green, yellow, lilac) ornamental band; geometric motifs. - Fol. 66rb: Narrow coloured (red, black) ornamental band; geometric motifs. - Fol. 74vb: Narrow coloured (red, green, yellow, black) ornamental band; geometric motifs. - Fol. 81vb: Narrow coloured (red, black) ornamental band; interlaces. - Fol. 88rb: Narrow coloured (red, black) ornamental band; interlaces and floral motifs. - Fol. 96ra: Narrow coloured (red, green, yellow, black) ornamental band; geometric motifs. - Fol. 102rb: Narrow coloured (red, green, black) ornamental band; geometric motifs. - Fol. 106vb: Narrow coloured (red, green, yellow, black) ornamental band; geometric motifs. - Fol. 116vb: Narrow coloured (red, green, yellow, black) ornamental band; geometric motifs. - Fol. 125vb: Narrow coloured (red, green, yellow, black) ornamental band; geometric motifs.
